1.title: Episode #4.1
1.plot: Boston Bruins offseason activities are highlighted: Matt Beleskey's tattoo on a tour of Shanghai, China; the introduction of David Backes to Boston, Massachusetts U.S.A.; and Joe Morrow at home on his farm in Edmonton, Alberta, Canada.

2.title: Episode #4.2
2.plot: Training camp starts at the new Warrior Ice Arena in Brighton, Boston, Massachusetts U.S.A.; defenseman Matt Grzelcyk debuts at TD Garden in Boston, Massachusetts U.S.A. where his father John has worked for over four decades; and more.

3.title: Episode #4.3
3.plot: After the traditional team party, the Boston Bruins open the 2016-2017 season at the Columbus Blue Jackets, Toronto Maple Leafs and Winnipeg Jets. Center Patrice Bergeron keys a win in the home opener vs. the New Jersey Devils; and more.

4.title: Episode #4.4
4.plot: New faces help the Boston Bruins get 2 road wins; Jimmy Hayes fights cancer in style; and Brad Marchand and company spread the Halloween spirit at Boston Children's Hospital.

5.title: Episode #4.5
5.plot: The Boston Bruins celebrate Thanksgiving with fans at home before heading to Ottawa, Ontario, Canada. Center, David Krejci tours the North End of Boston, Massachusetts U.S.A. with his wife and daughter.

6.title: Episode #4.6
6.plot: Boston Bruins center Frank Vatrano starts his road back to game action; defenseman Matt Grzelcyk makes his National Hockey League debut; and the Bruins celebrate the holidays with a family skate.

7.title: Episode #4.7
7.plot: The Boston Bruins spread some holiday cheer; defenseman Adam McQuaid and left wing Brad Marchand help make a dream come true; and Demetrius Jackson and Jaylen Brown of the Boston Celtics check out a game.

8.title: Episode #4.8
8.plot: Boston Bruins center/right wing David Backes returns to St. Louis, Missouri U.S.A.; left wing Brad Marchand shops for a new cowboy hat; and the team holds its first ever Moms trip.

9.title: Episode #4.9
9.plot: The Neely House gets a renovation; left wing Brad Marchand and goaltender Tuukka Rask experience their first National Hockey League All-Star Weekend; and a change at the head coach position takes place.

10.title: Episode #4.10
10.plot: The Bruins head out on the road to play four Western Conference teams, during which they have plenty of fun both on and off the ice.

11.title: Episode #4.11
11.plot: The Bruins make a trade at the deadline; left wing Brad Marchand is mic'd up vs. the Detroit Red Wings; defenseman Torey Krug walks his bulldog; and Fenway Park and TD Garden host Girls Hockey Day.

12.title: Episode #4.12
12.plot: The Bruins play locker room baseball; left wing Brad Marchand and center Patrice Bergeron receive their 2016 World Cup of Hockey championship rings; and the boys take part in Cuts for a Cause.

13.title: Episode #4.13
13.plot: Two Boston University Terriers become Boston Bruins; left wing Brad Marchand admires his mini-me; New England Patriots safety Patrick Chung trades in his cleats for skates; and the Bruins clinch a playoff berth.

1.title: Tour of the Bruins Training Facility
1.plot: The 2013 Stanley Cup loss to the Blackhawks through the drama of off-season trade decisions.

2.title: Abs and Lower Back (Core)
2.plot: Focuses on training camp and pre-season camps in the lead up to the 2013-2014 season.

3.title: The Journey Has Begun
3.plot: Episode 3 begins just before the start of the 2013-2014 season, and brings viewers from the annual team-building retreat through the first two games of the regular season, and features team owner Jeremy Jacobs.

4.title: Emotions Run High
4.plot: With injuries plaguing the team, the Bruins struggle to find consistency early in the 2013-2014 season.

5.title: Together as a Family
5.plot: The regular season continues in Episode 5 of Behind the B, bringing the team to Ottawa and through the first quarter of their schedule.

6.title: The Road
6.plot: Rivalries, injuries, illness and a long road trip make for a memorable December 2013. A member of the Boston Bruins proclaims himself as the team's best soccer player.

7.title: Progress
7.plot: Episode 7 begins by showing how injured players deal with rehabilitation, both physically and mentally. Some players visit Tuft's Floating Hospital for Children to hand out gifts and bring smiles to the children's faces. The team takes on Nashville just two days before Christmas and are elated with their dominating win. With multiple games in a short time frame, two young defenseman are given more playing time to give older players more rest. The episode concludes with the team finding out that Dennis Seidenberg is out for the season with a torn MCL. Spirits are high ...

8.title: Positive Additions
8.plot: Episode 8 starts with the Bruins going on a three-game "California road swing". Shawn Thornton's suspension is coming to an end, but they face three of the top teams in all of the Western Conference. Offenseman Loui Eriksson continues to heal, but is still not cleared to play as he meets with concussion specialists in California. The players explore California and some meet world-renowned chef Wolfgang Puck while dining at one of his restaurants. The first two games against the Ducks and Kings result in losses - but they are able to finish the trip with a win against ...

9.title: Projections
9.plot: Episode 9 begins with a win against Loui Eriksson's old team - the Dallas Stars. The team's goal before the Olympic break is to solidify their position on top of the Atlantic Conference. With the team headed to Chicago, the front office and scouting staff are in Las Vegas for their annual mid-season scouting meeting. The B's take their Stanley Cup opponent to OT. Rookie Kevan Miller signs a contract extension and receives congrats from teammates. The episode concludes with backup goalie Chad Johnson notching a big road win against the Islanders.

10.title: Surge Before Sochi
10.plot: Episode 10 picks up five games before the Olympic break, and the Bruins comfortably atop the division. The first of the games won't be easy as the B's have been win-less against the Canadiens thus far. Unfortunately, this game was no different. Less than 48 hours later though, Boston notches a win against former teammate Andrew Ference and the Edmonton Oilers. The team wins 2 out of their last 3 games including a 7-2 win over Ottawa as the Olympic break begins. The episode concludes with five of the Bruins traveling to Sochi for the Olympic Games.

11.title: Locked In
11.plot: Episode 11 begins during the 2014 Olympic break. Torey Krug and Kevan Miller use their last day off to watch teammate David Krejci play for the Czech Olympic team. When vacation ends, the team is back together for weigh-in and practice. While the B's are back together and practicing, some are still in Sochi battling for medal contention. Their first return game is in Buffalo, and despite a strong comeback the Bruins fall in OT. Back in Boston, Shawn Thornton rallies his team for 'Cuts for a Cause'. To Shawn it's simple, shave your head for charity or give a generous ...

12.title: Behind the Bear
12.plot: Episode 12 starts with a game on the road at the Florida Panthers. The rare 5:00 game resulted in a big 5-2 win. Bruins owner, Jeremy Jacobs invites the team to his home for a barbecue and a day off filled with great food, friends and fun. The Bruins are on the road in Montreal and build their division lead with their sixth win in a row. Fans made it clear that they want more "Tuukka Time" on Behind the B, so he is followed closely. Notching a few more wins, the Bruins have won 11 in a row, are the hottest team in the NHL, and have clinched a spot in the playoffs. The...

13.title: Finishing Strong
13.plot: Episode 13 begins with two weeks left in the regular season and the Bruins in 1st place in the Eastern Conference. The Bruins have a special visitor join them for practice - nine year-old Maddy from the Make a Wish Foundation. Patrice Bergeron nets two goals and Rask gets the shutout against the Blackhawks. The B's follow up with a win against the Capitals, a shootout victory against the Flyers on the road, and another win against the Flyers at home. There is a quick break in action for their team picture, and then it's off to play the Minnesota Wild. The episode ...

14.title: Four Down
14.plot: Episode 14 begins with the start of the playoff season, and the Bruins have earned home ice advantage with the best record in the NHL. Before play starts, the team gets together for a dinner to celebrate an outstanding regular season and prepare for what lies ahead. Round 1 of the playoffs begin with the Detroit Red Wings - the B's had trouble against them in the regular season, but won't let that stop them. Jimmy Howard and the Red Wings get the shutout as the Bruins drop the first game at home. The loss would be a distant memory though as the B's sweep the next four...

15.title: The End...
15.plot: The 15th, and final episode, begins with the 34th playoff meeting with the Montreal Canadiens. The Bruins rally late in game 1, but drop the first game in double OT at home. The B's win three of the next four games, with two of those wins coming on the road. This gives Boston a 3-2 series lead, and need just one more win to advance. Game 6 is a mystery as the Bruins can't figure out goaltender Carey Price, dropping game six 4-0. The Bruins hold game 7 on home ice - the Habs go up 2-0 in the 2nd period, but the B's cut it to 2-1 late. A penalty is taken in the 3rd ...

1.title: A New Season Begins
1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

2.title: Welcome Back...
2.plot: Trade rumors, contract negotiations and vacant roster spots provide the backdrop for the Boston Bruins 2014 training camp.

3.title: A Challenging Start
3.plot: Opening Night is a success but the next stretch of results are a mixed bag; a reunion with a former teammate gets overshadowed by an injury.

4.title: Tricks and Treats
4.plot: A four game win streak keeps the mood in the locker room upbeat - as does Halloween, the Dalai Lama and the 'Dumb and Dumber' Mutt Cutts van.

5.title: The Show Goes On
5.plot: The Boston Bruins take in the 20th annual Comics Come Home comedy show and carry on with their season despite being ravaged by injuries.

6.title: Turbulence
6.plot: A cross country flight to California U.S.A. kicks off an eight day road trip through Anaheim, Los Angeles, San Jose and Phoenix, Arizona U.S.A.; team captain and defenseman Zdeno Chara returns.

7.title: Goodbye to 2014
7.plot: The calendar turns to 2015 and the Boston Bruins are in an unfamiliar position - desperately fighting to crack the top 8 in the National Hockey League's Eastern Conference.

8.title: Streaking
8.plot: A five game win streak lifts the mood of the team. Rookie right wing David Pastrnak makes his case to stay with the club.

9.title: All-Star Break
9.plot: Most of the Boston Bruins have a few days off for the National Hockey League All-Star break, however, center Patrice Bergeron and scout Dean Malkoc do not.

10.title: Highs and Lows
10.plot: After recognizing the New England Patriots Super Bowl 49 title, the Boston Bruins embark on their longest road trip of the season.

11.title: Reinforcer
11.plot: The National Hockey League trade deadline brings two new arrivals to the roster. Center/right wing David Krejci continues his injury rehabilitation and the Boston Bruins push for the postseason.

12.title: Six to Go
12.plot: Six games are left in the regular season with the Boston Bruins on the playoff bubble. Center, Patrice Bergeron leads the team's Cuts for a Cause event.

13.title: Over and Out
13.plot: The Boston Bruins push for the postseason falls just short as the team fails to make the playoffs for the first time since 2007.

1.title: Welcome Back
1.plot: A new General Manager takes the reins of the organization and immediately makes an impact. Rookies and veterans prepare for a new season after a long summer.

2.plot: Sixty players enter training camp all competing to make the twenty-three man opening day roster.

3.title: Game On
3.plot: The 2015-2016 season gets off to a less than ideal start on home ice, however, a successful road trip raises the team's spirits.

4.title: Minions
4.plot: Zdeno Chara and his Minions get in to the Halloween spirit and hit a hot streak on the ice while Patrice Bergeron welcomes a new member to his family.

5.title: Thanksgiving Benchmark
5.plot: The Boston Bruins deal with uneven results on the ice. David Pastrnak finds a way to participate in the team's toy shopping event despite an injury.

6.title: Little Ball of Hate
6.plot: Brad Marchand reminds everyone why he is considered one of the biggest pests in the National Hockey League when the Boston Bruins renew acquaintances with the Vancouver Canucks.

7.title: Amazing Race
7.plot: A special episode as the team is split into four groups and participates in an 'Amazing Race'-style scavenger hunt around Boston, Massachusetts U.S.A.

8.title: Bumper to Bumper
8.plot: Five points on a five-game road trip throughout the Northeast has the Boston Bruins in the thick of what is shaping up to be a close playoff race.

9.title: New Friends and Old
9.plot: The Boston Bruins get together to watch a big football game; Patrice Bergeron brings the family to Nashville, Tennessee U.S.A.; and Boston welcomes back an old friend from the Los Angeles Kings.

10.title: Sharing the Love
10.plot: Brad Marchand gets the chance to let his teammates know how much they mean to him during the team's recent six-game, twelve-day road trip.

11.title: Like Father, Like Son
11.plot: A proud group of Bruins dads travel to Boston, Massachusetts U.S.A. and join their sons on a special road trip. New faces arrive and Chris Kelly returns to the ice.

12.title: The Nightmare
12.plot: During an off-day in Los Angeles California U.S.A., Frank Vatrano and the Boston Bruins rookies explore the city. A rough stretch on the ice improves with a win over the Toronto Maple Leafs.

13.title: The End
13.plot: Denna Laing and Boston Celtics' Evan Turner highlight the Boston Bruins off-ice happenings, but the 2015-2016 season ends in disappointment.

imdb.title: Behind the B
plot: This all-access documentary series about the storied Boston Bruins, one of the NHL's "Original Six" hockey teams gives viewers an inside perspective into the worlds of Bruins players, coaches, fans and management.::Boston Bruins
